messages.message: Hey team, I merged a PR that disables the license post-install action going forward - we recently removed the legacy license-service endpoints which the action depended on, and I don’t think its purpose (installing a default license) is relevant to AI Hub anyways. If you see issues related to new sandboxes not being licensed, please let me know!
For now, the action will still run but in a no-op mode. If everything seems fine we can fully deprecate it and remove the code in a few weeks\
You can re-enable the action with the `ENABLE_LICENSE_ACTION` env var on the job
Can we delete this action entirely from the code base?

hmm do we still need licenses for solution engineers to run flows to develop advanced apps though?

or does this fix (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05BJCNKZAM/p1745343187162279?thread_ts=1743157336.116089&cid=C05BJCNKZAM) eliminate the need for this? @Abhishek Adupa

License is not needed in AIhub environments, even for advanced apps. The changes and fixes have already been merged for the API layer, and everything now relies on Metronome.
I’m currently working on cleaning up the go code and moving a few handlers into core-platform so that the license-service can be deleted.
The license page is also removed from the UI
